intro: Smilax lyi, commonly known as the Mexican devil's backbone, is a climbing vine native to Mexico and Central America. It is characterized by its spiny stems and heart-shaped leaves with a waxy texture. The plant produces yellowish-green flowers that are followed by red, spiky berries. Smilax lyi is often found in humid, shaded environments such as forests and thickets. Its botanical features make it a distinctive and recognizable member of the Smilacaceae family.
